alert.note: Alert for Del Norte Interior; Northern Humboldt Coast; Northern Humboldt Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior; Southwestern Humboldt (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 2:48PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...Strong showers will impact portions of central Humboldt and southeastern Del Norte Counties through 345 PM... At 247 PM, Doppler radar was tracking heavy showers along a line extending from 8 miles north of Orick to 20 miles west of Petrolia. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. Winds will shift from southerly to west or northwest as the line moves through. An isolated thunderstorm is possible. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eureka, Arcata, Orick, Hoopa, Willow Creek, Fortuna, Rio Dell, Trinidad, Weitchpec, McKinleyville, Maple Creek, Carlotta, Westhaven-Moonstone, Scotia, Petrolia, Ferndale, Blue Lake, Myrtletown, Cutten and Hydesville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Del Norte Interior; Northern Humboldt Coast; Northern Humboldt Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior; Southwestern Humboldt
